'''Less Can Be More''' is a song written by [[Maury Laws]] (music) and [[Jules Bass]] (lyric) and performed by [[Glenn Yarbrough]] for the [[1980]] animated movie [[The Return of the King (1980 film)|''The Return of the King'']]. The song plays after [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] refuses to claim the [[One Ring]], over a montage of him fantasising about a simple life with his family in the Shire after the Ring's destruction.

==Lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Less can be more,
And small can be beautiful,
For life isn't all
Just big and wonderful.

And what do I need,
When you get right down to it?
All my cares come from greed,
And it's time that I knew it.

Things I can't do without
Are the small things that life is all about.

Less can be more,
And small can be beautiful,
I don't want it all;
Just part of wonderful.

For what do I need,
When you get right down to it?
Just a garden and seed,
And the love to pursue it.

Things I can't do without
Are the small things that life is all about.
</poem>
